Kennedy |doctoral_students = |known_for = [[Reversible-jump Markov chain Monte Carlo]] |author_abbrev_bot = |author_abbrev_zoo = |influences = |influenced = |prizes = [[Guy Medal]] {{small|(Bronze, 1987) (Silver, 1999)}} |religion = |footnotes = |signature = }} '''Peter Green''', [[Fellow of the Royal Society|FRS]] (born 28 April 1950)[http://www.debretts.com/people/biographies/search/results/23238/Peter%20James+GREEN.aspx Prof Peter Green] at [[Debrett's People of Today|Debrett's ''People of Today'']]. Accessed 2011-01-23. is a British [[Bayesian statistics|Bayesian]] [[statistician]]. He is Emeritus Professor and Professorial Research Fellow at the [[University of Bristol]], and a Professor at the [[University of Technology, Sydney]]. He is distinguished for his contributions to [[computational statistics]], in particular his contributions to [[spatial statistics]] and semi-parametric [[regression model]]s and also his development of [[reversible-jump]] [[Markov chain Monte Carlo]]. Green was born in [[Solihull]] and attended [[Solihull School]]. He studied mathematics at [[Oxford University]] before moving to the [[University of Sheffield]] for postgraduate study, where he was awarded an MSc in probability and statistics and a PhD in applied probability.{{cite web|url=http://www.stats.bris.ac.uk/people/faculty/mapjg/|title=Prof Peter Green|publisher=University of Bristol|accessdate=13 June 2014}} He was elected a [[Fellow of the Royal Society]] in 2003. He served as President of the [[Royal Statistical Society]] from 2001 to 2003,[http://www.rss.org.uk/main.asp?page=2862 Past Presidents]. Royal Statistical Society. Accessed 2009-04-26. having previously been awarded its [[Guy Medal]] in both Bronze (1987) and Silver (1999).[http://www.rss.org.uk/main.asp?page=1733 Honours & Awards: Previous Recipients]. Royal Statistical Society. Accessed 2009-04-26. He held a [[Royal Society Wolfson Research Merit Award]] from 2006 to 2011. He was President of the [[International Society for Bayesian Analysis]] for the year 2007. He is editor of the journal [[Statistical Science]] for 2014-2016. ==References== ==External links== * [http://www.stats.bris.ac.uk/people/faculty/mapjg/ Peter Green's homepage].
